**Edited**: I found something interesting.

You know how the terminators look weird when using both scatterer and EVE? By making the atmosphere draw on top of the clouds instead of under, the terminator can be made really soft.

Before:

![YmqbgEV.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/YmqbgEV.jpg)

After:

![hCZrCZr.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/hCZrCZr.jpg)

The shadows don't disappear either, they're there, but subtler, can mostly be seen to the left, in the brightest area:

![rlQGeON.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/rlQGeON.jpg)

![TJdZwmd.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/TJdZwmd.jpg)

![mNZBhWl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/mNZBhWl.jpg)

![GVP3mDc.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/GVP3mDc.jpg)

In a way this is wrong as it treats the clouds as if they were at the ground level, but I find the end results looks pleasing and more homegeneous.

Thoughts on this? [@Proot](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/98932-proot/) [@Nhawks17](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/32999-nhawks17/) [@pingopete](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/74168-pingopete/)
